H0.text: What is the common single-celled green algae which is responsible for turning stagnant water an opaque green. Euglena

H1.text: What is the common single-celled green algae which is responsible for turning stagnant water an opaque green. Dunaliella

H2.text: What is the common single-celled green algae which is responsible for turning stagnant water an opaque green. Haematococcus

H3.text: What is the common single-celled green algae which is responsible for turning stagnant water an opaque green. Chlorella

A4.text: Chlorella is a genus of about thirteen species of single-celled or colonial green algae of the division Chlorophyta.

A5.text: The cells are spherical in shape, about 2 to 10 Î¼m in diameter, and are without flagella.
